item.description:
This is a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of the world. Great Pond is a shallow pond with lots of waterfowl. It is surrounded by pine and hemlock woodlands. There are interesting places to sit and rest with a wonderful view of the pond. The forest was selected to be Tree Farm Number One in Connecticut, meaning it was receiving good timber management while privately owned. The owner, James L Goodwin, bequeathed the property to the State as a public sanctuary.

This will be an easy walk of about 2 miles with very level walking. Social walking pace. We will be out for about 1 hour. The walk will be rescheduled if there is a threat of rain.

Dogs and children are welcome as long as they are calm and well behaved.

Location: Caution, Don’t confuse this place with another place with a similar name. This one is in Simsbury. (Approximate address, no mailbox there) 152 Great Pond Rd, Simsbury Center, CT.
http://maps.google.co...

group.name: The Hartford Area Hiking™ Meetup Group

item.name: Great Pond State Forest Walk, Simsbury, CT
